intro: Sida longistipula, commonly known as the long-stipitate sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish, and clustered in inflorescences. Sida longistipula is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and wetlands.
